title: Decouple storage from compute
description: Your initial design choice could have significant cost impact. Understand the resource requirements of your workload. Decouple storage from compute to enable independent scaling and allow compute resources to be terminated when not in use while data persists in cost-effective storage like Amazon S3.

title_full: DALCOST11-BP02 Plan and provision capacity for predictable workload usage
title: Plan and provision capacity for predictable workload usage
description: For predictable workloads with consistent patterns, plan capacity in advance and consider Reserved Instances or Savings Plans to reduce costs. Understand your steady-state resource requirements and optimize provisioning accordingly.

title_full: DALCOST11-BP03 Use On-Demand Instance capacity for unpredictable workload usage
title: Use On-Demand Instance capacity for unpredictable workload usage
description: For unpredictable or spiky workloads, use On-Demand capacity to avoid over-provisioning. This approach provides flexibility while avoiding the commitment of reserved capacity for workloads with variable resource requirements.

title_full: DALCOST11-BP04 Use auto scaling where appropriate
title: Use auto scaling where appropriate
description: Auto scaling can scale resources up and down based on workload demand, leading to cost reductions during low demand periods. Use Amazon Redshift elastic resize, EMR managed scaling, and AWS Glue auto scaling to optimize costs dynamically.

title_full: DALCOST12-BP01 Measure data storage and processing costs per user of the workload
title: Measure data storage and processing costs per user of the workload
description: Establish a financial attribution model for analytics resources. Implement cost allocation tags and reporting to measure storage and processing costs per user, team, or business unit. This promotes accountability and enables chargeback models.

title_full: DALCOST12-BP02 Balance agility and skill sets when building local vs centralized platforms
title: Balance agility and skill sets when building local vs centralized platforms
description: Data analytics systems will grow into a mix of shared and isolated-team resources. Evaluate the trade-offs between centralized platforms that provide economies of scale versus decentralized approaches that offer team agility. Consider team expertise and governance requirements.

title_full: DALCOST12-BP03 Build a common shared processing system and measure cost per analytics job
title: Build a common shared processing system and measure cost per analytics job
description: Create shared analytics infrastructure where appropriate and implement job-level cost tracking. Use resource tagging and cost allocation to measure the cost of individual analytics jobs, enabling optimization and chargeback.

title_full: DALCOST12-BP04 Restrict and record resource allocation permissions using IAM
title: Restrict and record resource allocation permissions using IAM
description: Use AWS IAM to control who can provision and manage analytics resources. Implement approval workflows for resource provisioning and maintain audit trails of resource allocation decisions to prevent uncontrolled cost growth.

title_full: DALCOST13-BP01 Remove unused data and infrastructure
title: Remove unused data and infrastructure
description: Analytics workloads often have ever-growing data volumes. Implement standardized processes to identify and remove unused resources such as unused data, infrastructure, and ETL jobs. Regularly review and clean up orphaned resources to reduce costs.

title: Reduce overprovisioning infrastructure
description: Periodically review your workload to discover opportunities to right-size resources. Use AWS Compute Optimizer and cost management tools to identify over-provisioned resources. Implement continuous optimization processes.

title_full: DALCOST13-BP03 Evaluate and adopt new cost-effective solutions
title: Evaluate and adopt new cost-effective solutions
description: Regularly review existing architectural decisions to ensure cost efficiency. Evaluate new or updated AWS services that can support the same workload at lower cost. Consider serverless options and managed services that may reduce operational overhead.

title_full: DALCOST14-BP01 Evaluate infrastructure usage patterns and choose payment options accordingly
title: Evaluate infrastructure usage patterns and choose payment options accordingly
description: Understand the infrastructure usage patterns of your analytics workload including steady-state vs bursty usage. Optimize costs by selecting appropriate purchasing options such as Reserved Instances, Savings Plans, Spot Instances, or On-Demand based on usage patterns.

title_full: DALCOST14-BP02 Consult with your finance team and determine optimal payment models
title: Consult with your finance team and determine optimal payment models
description: Work with your finance team to select optimal purchasing options considering factors like upfront payment capabilities, commitment length, and budget flexibility. Balance the trade-offs between cost savings and commitment risk.
